elements.description: Scopus coverage is applicable to humanities titles and includes all serial publication types, like journals, book series, and conference series. As of 2014, over 116,000 book titles have been added to Scopus. Arts and humanities titles are part of the social sciences subject cluster in Scopus.

elements.element: Requirements for structural elements of the report

description.title: The title must clearly represent the content.
description.coverage: Scopus was launched in 2004, containing 14,200 journals with approximately 7,500 new titles added since 2004. It covers references going back to 1996 and, from 2014, references going back to 1970.
description.content_addition: Content for newly added journals starts from the most recent journal issue in the acceptance year. Back file content may be covered if provided.
description.publisher: Content obtained from over 5000 publishers worldwide, with 85% received electronically or sourced from journal websites.
description.abstracts_availability: 73% of all articles in Scopus have an abstract going back to 1823; 84% of all records after 1995 have abstracts.

article.Length: Several pages or as short as one page

editorial_roles.must be: senior researchers experienced in editorial roles responsible for reviewing all the titles within a specific subject area

gost_params.title: The title must clearly represent the content.

language_skills.must be: enough to read and evaluate journals publishing in languages other than English

content coverage policy.must be: used to accept/reject a title for inclusion in Scopus

benefits include: feedback on why their title was accepted or rejected

gost_params.publication_type: Publication type must be either Journals, Book series or Conference series.
gost_params.coverage: Scopus covers from the day it was launched. References are covered going back to 1970.
gost_params.content_addition: Starts with the most recent issue in the acceptance year. May cover back files if provided.
gost_params.publisher: Content is sourced from publishers. 85% of content is sourced electronically or from journal websites.
gost_params.abstracts_availability: Abstracts are available for 73% of articles going back to 1823 and for 84% of records after 1995.
gost_params.medline_coverage: Covers all 5,000 MEDLINE titles from 1966 and includes OLDMEDLINE content published between 1949 and 1965.
gost_params.content_processing: Fastest processing and indexing for content received via e-Feeds or downloads from journal websites. Usually takes 2-3 weeks. Content supplied in paper format takes 4-5 weeks.
gost_params.articles_in_press: Articles-in-Press are pre-published versions of accepted articles.
gost_params.content_sources: Content is received from over 5,000 publishers worldwide, with the majority being electronically received or sourced from journal websites.
